definition: foreshadowing (literary device)/foretaste of material to come (in essay or story)
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: In such a multi-ethnic country that would be a recipe for further disintegration.
sentences.chinese: 而那將給這樣一個多民族國家的進一步解體埋下伏筆。

sentences.english: I will be happy to seed the discussion with a few topics.
sentences.chinese: 我將非常樂於用幾個主題爲該討論埋下伏筆。

sentences.english: That's what's written underneath it on the contract.
But the China capital organization will repeatedly violate a regulation will lay down without doubt for a next huger disaster the foreshadowing.
sentences.chinese: 而中資機構屢次犯規無疑將爲今後更大災害埋下伏筆。

sentences.english: Along the way are always is, around that moment of the fall of all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 一路上都是伏筆，回身的那刻全世界都失陷了。

sentences.english: This will lay the practical groundwork for the third act.
sentences.chinese: 這就給第三幕埋下了伏筆。

sentences.english: I reserved foreshadowing, suffer a big.
sentences.chinese: 我預留的伏筆，一敗塗地。

sentences.english: Well Jesus! So Melchizedek is simply a foreshadowing, he's a sign of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌，所以麥基洗德只是一個伏筆，他是耶穌的跡象。

definition: shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
to die peacefully/(fig.) to result in failure (without any outside interference)/to come to nothing/to fizzle out
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
